metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7742 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In libsndfile before 1.0.28, an error in the "flac_buffer_copy()" function (flac.c) can be exploited to cause a segmentation violation (with read memory access) via a specially crafted FLAC file during a resample attempt, a similar issue to CVE-2017-7585.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2
sndfile-programs - 1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.25-7ubuntu2.2').
